title: DateTime
description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm] (see Chapter 5.4 of ISO 8601).

http://schema.org/availabilityEnds.description: The end of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

http://schema.org/availableThrough.description: After this date, the item will no longer be available for pickup.

http://schema.org/paymentDueDate.description: The date that payment is due. Supersedes paymentDue.

http://schema.org/dropoffTime.description: When a rental car can be dropped off.

http://schema.org/ownedThrough.description: The date and time of giving up ownership on the product.

http://schema.org/availableFrom.description: When the item is available for pickup from the store, locker, etc.

http://schema.org/endTime.description: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*.Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

http://schema.org/datasetTimeInterval.description: The range of temporal applicability of a dataset, e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 (in ISO 8601 time interval format). Supersedes temporal.

http://schema.org/dateIssued.description: The date the ticket was issued.

http://schema.org/dateModified.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

http://schema.org/scheduledTime.description: The time the object is scheduled to.

http://schema.org/expectedArrivalUntil.description: The latest date the package may arrive.

http://schema.org/startTime.description: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December.Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

http://schema.org/ownedFrom.description: The date and time of obtaining the product.

http://schema.org/modifiedTime.description: The date and time the reservation was modified.

http://schema.org/coverageEndTime.description: The time when the live blog will stop covering the Event. Note that coverage may continue after the Event concludes.

http://schema.org/checkoutTime.description: The latest someone may check out of a lodging establishment.

http://schema.org/pickupTime.description: When a taxi will pickup a passenger or a rental car can be picked up.

http://schema.org/dateDeleted.description: The datetime the item was removed from the DataFeed.

http://schema.org/webCheckinTime.description: The time when a passenger can check into the flight online.

http://schema.org/checkinTime.description: The earliest someone may check into a lodging establishment.

http://schema.org/validThrough.description: The end of the validity of offer, price specification, or opening hours data.

http://schema.org/dateCreated.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

http://schema.org/validFrom.description: The date when the item becomes valid.

http://schema.org/coverageStartTime.description: The time when the live blog will begin covering the Event. Note that coverage may begin before the Event's start time. The LiveBlogPosting may also be created before coverage begins.

http://schema.org/availabilityStarts.description: The beginning of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

http://schema.org/bookingTime.description: The date and time the reservation was booked.

http://schema.org/expectedArrivalFrom.description: The earliest date the package may arrive.
